title.narrative: Decent Jobs for Tunisias Yougn People

description.narrative: The project is implemented in a context characteristics by youth employment issues, especially with regard to strong regional disparities, an increasing informalisation of the labour market and limited employment opportunities for women.

participating-org.narrative: International Labour Organisation - Regular Budget Supplementary Account

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation

title.narrative: Recent (2013) labour market data and data on youth employment are reflected in the National Employment Policy (NEP) A tripartite agreemment is reached on the NEP and covering key policy fields with an impact on employment demand and supply. The NEP is adopted by the Government and financed by the third of of the programme; a national inter-ministerial committee on the NEP with the social partners supervises its implementation. The NEP preparation process, its final adoption and follow-up feature regularly among the national media; conferences and consulations are undertaken including at local level.
Agro-alimentary valuechains and products with strongest employment potential are promoted

target.value:
2 business development service (BDS) providers are capable by the end of the project to broker partnerships (producer/buyer. investment). coach entrepreneurs and support marketing in high-potential value chains.
10 cooperative promoters are trained per Governorate (total of 30) and facilitate the formation/strengthening of coops in respective areas to meet unmet demand for north-western products.
At least 3 public/private new productive projects are launched by the end of the project. for products with high potential.
At least 10 local producers have partnered with large buyers or investors from Tunisia or abroad.

2 BDS providers are capable by the end of the project to broker partnerships (producer/buyer. investment). coach entrepreneurs and support marketing in high-potential value chains.
10 cooperative promoters are trained per Governorate (total of 30) and facilitate the formation/strengthening of coops in respective areas to meet unmet demand for north-western products.
At least 3 public/private new productive projects are launched by the end of the project. for products with high potential.
At least 10 local producers have partnered with large buyers or investors from Tunisia or abroad.

actual.value: 3 value chains and delegations of intervention chosen; Contracts w. 3 BDS; 3 brands established: APIS VARGA (honey. Béjasous). ASALNA (honey. Jendouba) and Volailles ZAMA (poultry. Siliana) and presented at international and local agricultural fairs Contracts w. 3 SME's for poultry sale In all governorates 13 tech. dev. fora. app. 450 participants selected. equipment furnished. technical and practical training (bee-keeping or poultry farming). training in finances. marketing and co-operatives. 2 guides on poultry farming developed. With ANETI 97 participants trained in SME management over 12 months 91 participants accessed formal economy via admission to the Tunisian Union of Farmers & Fishermen Microcredits provided thorugh TAYSIR - 23 obtained. 40 requests submitted

target.value:
2 BDS providers are capable by the end of the project to broker partnerships (producer/buyer. investment). coach entrepreneurs and support marketing in high-potential value chains.
10 cooperative promoters are trained per Governorate (total of 30) and facilitate the formation/strengthening of coops in respective areas to meet unmet demand for north-western products.
At least 3 public/private new productive projects are launched by the end of the project. for products with high potential.
At least 10 local producers have partnered with large buyers or investors from Tunisia or abroad.

actual.value: A mapping of institutions. A report identifying the value chains with the strongest employment opportunities - value chains of organic bee keeping and poultry farming prioritised and local delegations of intervention chosen in each governorate Training for Rural Empowerment carried out regionally (57 technical partners) and nationally (60 governmental and social partners).

target.value:
2 BDS providers are capable by the end of the project to broker partnerships (producer/buyer. investment). coach entrepreneurs and support marketing in high-potential value chains.
10 cooperative promoters are trained per Governorate (total of 30) and facilitate the formation/strengthening of coops in respective areas to meet unmet demand for north-western products.
At least 3 public/private new productive projects are launched by the end of the project. for products with high potential.
At least 10 local producers have partnered with large buyers or investors from Tunisia or abroad.

actual.value: Contracts w. 3 BDS extended until 30 June 2017. Further training and formalisation of participants businesses. Folder on good practices of PEJTUN. 4 cooperatives established and incentive bonus received (Gov. of Jendouba) 148 microcredits obtained from various sources 68 follow-up grants (ANETI) obtained and 35 applications for investment submitted (CRDA) A

title.narrative: Improved employability of young unemployed men and women. -Needs identied in terms of competences required to respond to regional economic opportunities - Apprenticeship improved

target.value:
At least 2000 young people benefit from improved skills training. and at least 60% of these access wage employment.
Vocational Training Centres cover 10% more school drop-outs through upgraded informal apprenticeships
Capacity of at least 3 community based groups is strengthened to identify local skill needs of un- and underemployed youth and address them

actual.value: A tripartite project organisation has been established with PEJTUN. CONAP and local CLS. Action plan for the promotion of training centres for young rural girls (2015-2020) designed (under the Tunisian Agency of Professional Training).

target.value:
At least 2000 young people benefit from improved skills training. and at least 60% of these access wage employment.
Vocational Training Centres cover 10% more school drop-outs through upgraded informal apprenticeships
Capacity of at least 3 community based groups is strengthened to identify local skill needs of un- and underemployed youth and address them

actual.value: Implementation of the action plan for the promotion of training centres for young rural girls (2015-2020) through entrepreneurship tools and training of trainers and apprencticeship counsellors so as to strengthen their compentencies in regard to training of youth (in particular young girls) and the creation of/employment with SMEs. ToT manual: financial edu. for trainers on the 'stepping stone space'. Learningclub' created in the trianing centres of the Tunisian Agency of Professional Training. A study (diagnosis) of apprenticeship in the 4 governorates as basis for recommended improvements to youth apprenticeship + employability.

target.value:
At least 2000 young people benefit from improved skills training. and at least 60% of these access wage employment.
Vocational Training Centres cover 10% more school drop-outs through upgraded informal apprenticeships
Capacity of at least 3 community based groups is strengthened to identify local skill needs of un- and underemployed youth and address them

At least 2000 young people benefit from improved skills training. and at least 60% of these access wage employment.
Vocational Training Centres cover 10% more school drop-outs through upgraded informal apprenticeships
Capacity of at least 3 community based groups is strengthened to identify local skill needs of un- and underemployed youth and address them

actual.value: Study of youth attitude towards apprenticeship completed. validated and discussed with stakeholders in the 4 governorates. Trainers manual and trainees booklet on financial education ready.

title.narrative: Increase in the percentage of local public investments in economic/productive projects

target.value: Provide support for the participation of national and local private actors in the definition. financing and implementation of regional development plans (including PPPs)

actual.value: A national guidancenote on the 5 year development plan adopted by the Council of Ministers. The local project coordinators provided technical and strategical assistance to the regional consultations and commissions in co-operation with GiZ (leader of the process in the governorates of the project). The assistance resulted in four documents: a development diagnosis. a vision. a synthesis and new project proposals for the 4 governorates. Technical capacity developed of local monitoring committees to contribute to the drafting of regional development plans ( HRBA and RBM).

target.value: Provide support for the participation of national and local private actors in the definition. financing and implementation of regional development plans (including PPPs)

actual.value: Technical capacity developed of local monitoring committees to contribute to the drafting of regional development plans ( human rights based approach and results-based management).

target.value: Provide support for the participation of national and local private actors in the definition. financing and implementation of regional development plans (including PPPs)

title.narrative: Young unemployed women and men are capable of creating and maintaining their own businesses. A strengthened culture of entrepreneurship

target.value:
Youth in the target areas have a significantly better and more favourable understanding of entrepreneurship as a career option.
1000 young people (30% women) have access to mentoring. business plan

actual.value: A FR version of the Young Business Advisors Guide for ANETI counsellors on accompanying young entrepreneurs. Business game kits for ANETI. A study of youth attitude towards entrepreneurship in Beja. Jendouba. Silliana and Kef validatedby gov't + social stakeholders in regions +nationally. A regional day on training. employment + private initiative w.Ariana Governorate.

target.value:
Youth in the target areas have a significantly better and more favourable understanding of entrepreneurship as a career option.
1000 young people (30% women) have access to mentoring. business plan

actual.value: French version of the tool 'GERME' published (on improved management of your business) and training provided for micro-credit departments of ANETI (Tunisian Agency of Employment and Independent Work). First exchanges on potential collaboration with the programme Souk Attanmia (AfDB).

target.value:
Youth in the target areas have a significantly better and more favourable understanding of entrepreneurship as a career option.
1000 young people (30% women) have access to mentoring. business plan

Youth in the target areas have a significantly better and more favourable understanding of entrepreneurship as a career option.
1000 young people (30% women) have access to mentoring. business plan

actual.value: Trainingof 43 counsellors on accompanying young entrepreneurs. Study on youth perception available. Joint conference on economic autonomy of women craftsworkers (with the PROMESS project and UTICA. financed by NL)

title.narrative: Additional services furnished by employment centres at the local level for at least 50,000 job seekers (see above under outcome indicator)

target.value: services furnished by employment centres at the local level for at least 50.000 job seekers
